intro: Gymnanthera nitida, commonly known as the velvet tamarind, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Gymnanthera nitida is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
